results.title: Thailand: land of rice
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a view of Thailand and its people, including sequences on rice farming, the way of life of a typical farm family, and the floating markets on the canals and harbour of Bangkok.

results.title: Thailand for sale
results.creator_credit: David Jay, CTE and Small World Productions
results.brief_description: Annually, Thailand reaps a financial reward from thousands of tourists. However, the tourism boom has had a destructive effect upon the Thai people, flora and fauna. In an effort to capture the tourist dollar, luxury resorts have been built with no regard for the lives of local inhabitants. This program looks at Phuket and its problems from a local perspective, investigating the reality behind the paradise illusion.

results.title: Thailand's streams of life
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: The broad and busy rivers of Thailand are her life blood. In the development of river communications, of irrigation schemes, and of fishing. Thailand works closely with the UN. The efficiently organised river traffic has provided a model for UN technical assistance advisers; loans from the International Bank help the advancement of irrigation and flood control project; and a Food and Agriculture Organisation Commission cooperates with local experts in fishery research.

results.title: Thai Airways fly 748
results.creator_credit: Paul Cullerne, British Information Services and Technical and Scientific Films
results.brief_description: The British Hawker 748 seen in daily scheduled operation with Thai Airways against the spectacular scenery and colourful background of Thailand. The aircraft are seen in service on Thailand’s internal routes and in production at Manchester. Features of the aircraft are explained and its ease of servicing illustrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Cullerne, British Information Services and Technical and Scientific Films

results.title: Texture (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”
Studies in hard, rough, soft, smooth surfaces provide a tangible approach to understanding textural qualities in art. Points out the various textural effects which can be achieved with clay, metals, paper, linoleum, and other art materials.

results.title: Textiles and ornamental arts of India
results.creator_credit: Charles Eames, Ray Eames, Eames and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Displays the variety, sophistication, and beauty of India’s textiles and ornamental arts in a unique filmic interpretation of a exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City. Captures the flavour of Indian traditions and philosophy, and explores the spiritual significance of art in the everyday life of the Indian people.

results.title: Textiles
results.creator_credit: John C. Elder and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the Scottish textile industry, showing the relation between the centres of the various industries and the resources of raw materials and driving-power for the mills. The process of manufacture of tweeds, linen, sailcloth from jute, and cotton and silk thread are shown in detail.

results.title: Texas: Instant Cities
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Architecture at the Crossroads Series”.
Part of a series which examines the main themes in world architecture, the work of architects who are at the centre of the current debate and introduces younger architects who are beginning to make a name for themselves. Part Nine deals with Texas, which issues more building permissions each year than any other State. Houston and Dallas have consequently become the most exciting cities in which to look at architecture. These “pop-up” cities are like a blackboard on which the problems of modern architecture are being chalked up. They show the 21st Century in the making - a prospect that is intriguing, daring and deeply disturbing.

results.title: Testing intelligence with the Stanford-Binet
results.brief_description: Records the actions of four children to selected items from the Stanford-Binet intelligence test. Explains the meaning of mental age and the calculation of the intelligence quotient.
